oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 5 from oral history interview with James Stephen Turner, 2006 June 21
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville business and civic leader James Stephen (Steve) Turner, conducted on 21 June 2006 by Andrea Blackman as part of the Nashville Public Library's Nashville Business Leaders Oral History Project: The Turner Interviews. Turner discusses his definition of success, both while growing up and today. Turner explains that while success once meant financial success, it now means having a positive influence on others through generosity of spirit. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.
